Your goal is to optimize the query for retrieving more relevant search results. This is the initial query : {}. And this is the three relevant page titles : {}. Just output the json.
hyde: {'title': 'Enhancing Diffusion Properties of Metal-Organic Frameworks through Machine Learning Optimized Surface Functionalization', 'abstract': 'The development of efficient gas separation technologies relies heavily on the optimization of metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) for enhanced diffusion properties. This study employs machine learning techniques to predict and optimize surface functionalization strategies for MOFs, with a focus on improving diffusivity. By integrating machine learning algorithms with computational simulations, we successfully identified a set of optimal surface functional groups that enhance gas separation efficiency by up to 30%. Our findings demonstrate the potential of machine learning in accelerating the design and development of next-generation MOFs for industrial applications. This research contributes to the growing field of materials science and provides valuable insights into the optimization of MOF architectures for improved diffusion properties.'}
all_queries: "Machine Learning" AND (diffusion OR diffusivity) AND (MOFs OR ZIFs OR "metal-organic frameworks" OR COFs OR "covalent-organic frameworks);Machine Learning AND (diffusion OR diffusivity) AND (MOFs OR ZIFs OR metal-organic frameworks OR COFs OR covalent-organic frameworks OR porous materials OR nanomaterials OR adsorption OR sorption)
